DataElement.preferredName: Cytomegalovirus DNA Positive Unrelated Antiviral Agent Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication as to whether antiviral agents, unrelated to CMV DNAemia were administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cytomegalovirus DNA Positive Unrelated Antiviral Agent Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An indication that cytomegalovirus DNA has been detected in a sample._Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship._Any agent that can treat or prevent viral infections by interfering with the viral replication cycle.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Cytomegalovirus DNA Positive Unrelated Antiviral Agent
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An indication that cytomegalovirus DNA has been detected in a sample._Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship._Any agent that can treat or prevent viral infections by interfering with the viral replication cycle.

Concepts.definition: An indication that cytomegalovirus DNA has been detected in a sample.
Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.
Any agent that can treat or prevent viral infections by interfering with the viral replication cycle.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
